folder: Forsyth Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, west side, north from (No. 55) and including Hester Street.
July 18, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
A further view northward. These buildings will be demolished for the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.
July 18, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hester Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Hester Street, south side, west from Forsyth, to and including Chrystie Streets, showing P.S. No. 7, at the S.E. corner of the latter.

August 1, 1929.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, at a later date, as seen across clearance for Sarah Delano Park. The street in the foreground is Forsyth; Chrystie appears across the top of view.

July 31, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Forsyth Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Forsyth Street, east side, south from, but not including Hester, to and including Canal Streets, as seen from Chrystie Street, and a cross construction for the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park. P.S. No. 65, is shown at Nos. 42-52 Forsyth Street.

July 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, showing a closer view of P.S. No. 65.

October 12, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Forsyth Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, north from Hester Street, and showing clearance
for the new Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.

August 25, 1930.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same, at a later date, and showing the west side of Chrystie
Street across clearance.
October 12, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(3)
The same, from a view point slightly northward, (Grand Street) and
showing park under construction.
July 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hester Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1) Hester Street, south side, west from Forsyth, to and including Chrystie Streets, as seen from Forsyth Street, and across clearance for the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park. Shown at the S.E. corner of Chrystie Street, is P.S. No. 7. July 23, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

(2) The same, from a different angle. Also shown is Chrystie Street, west side, at Hester Street. July 23, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 1, at a later date, showing the Manhattan Bridge Plaza at Canal Street. Buildings on the right, are on Chrystie Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Canal Street. P.S. No.7, as shown in No's. 1 & 2, occupied the extreme right of this clearance. October 12, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

folder: Hester Street & Forsyth Street, Manhattan, NY
text:

(2) The same, from a different angle. Also shown is Chrystie Street, west side, at Hester Street. July 23, 1930. P. L. Sperr.

(3) The same as No. 1, at a later date, showing the Manhattan Bridge Plaza at Canal Street. Buildings on the right, are on Chrystie Street, at, adjoining and north of the N.W. corner of Canal Street. P.S. No.7, as shown in No's. 1 & 2, occupied the extreme right of this clearance. October 12, 1931. P. L. Sperr.

folder: Forsyth Street & Hester Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
Forsyth Street, east side, north from and including Hester, to and including East Houston Streets, as seen from Chrystie Street, and across construction for the Sarah Delano Roosevelt Park.

July 18, 1934.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
The same; slightly northward and showing the completed playground, a part of the park.

About 1936.

P. L. Sperr.
